snippet: Any American influence left in Iraq should focus on rebuilding the credibility of national institutions.
abstract: Op-Ed article by policy expert Zaid al-Ali warns breakup of Iraq along sectarian lines, action supported by some as cure to nation's woes, will only worsen problems there; holds corruption, rather than sectarian strife, is main source of country's ills, and that breakup would only exacerbate government incompetence; urges United States to support reformation of Iraq's political structure.
lead_paragraph: Any American influence left in Iraq should focus on rebuilding the credibility of national institutions.

headline.main: Iraq’s Rot Starts at the Top
headline.print_headline: Iraq’s Rot Starts at the Top

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
